pages.speaker: fisher
lines: To start fishing, you'll need a Poké Rod and some bait.
Cast your line into the water, and wait for a Pokémon to bite!

pages.speaker: fisher
lines: Bait helps attract specific types of Pokémon to your line.
Different baits can increase your chances of catching certain Pokémon.

pages.speaker: fisher
lines: The Poké Rod is essential for fishing Pokémon.
It allows you to cast your line, reel in Pokémon, and handle your catches.

pages.speaker: fisher
lines: You can catch a variety of Pokémon, from common ones like Magikarp to rare and elusive species.
Some Pokémon might only appear in specific bodies of water or under certain conditions.

pages.speaker: fisher
lines: There are several types of bait you can use:
• **Worms** – Great for common water Pokémon.
• **Insect Attractants** – Increases chances for bug-type Pokémon.
• **Shiny Lures** – Helps in catching rare shiny Pokémon.

pages.speaker: fisher
lines: Using the Poké Rod is simple:
1. Equip your Poké Rod from your inventory.
2. Select the bait you want to use.
3. Right-click (or the equivalent action) to cast your line.
4. Wait for a Pokémon to bite, then reel it in!

pages.speaker: fisher
lines: Here are some tips to improve your fishing:
• **Use the right bait** for the Pokémon you're targeting.
• **Check the water's condition**; calm waters are better for certain catches.
• **Upgrade your Poké Rod** to access more powerful fishing techniques.

pages.speaker: fisher
lines: • **Time your casts**; some Pokémon are more active during certain times of the day.
• **Keep an eye on the bobber**; subtle movements might indicate a strong Pokémon bite.
• **Stock up on bait** before heading out to avoid interruptions during your fishing sessions.

lines.expression: Happy fishing, ' + q.player.username + '! May you catch many wonderful Pokémon on your journey.
